title: Girl, 6, given weeks to live after 'arm sprain' turns out to be cancer
desc: A little girl whose arm pain was dismissed as a sprain has been given just weeks to live after her symptoms turned out to be a rare form of cancer.

title: O'Neill may not attend White House for St Patrick's Day
desc: Northern Ireland First Minister Michelle O'Neill has said that she may not attend St Patrick's Day events in the White House again this year.

title: Moody’s raises Israel’s credit outlook
desc: The international credit ratings agency has noted the improvement in the geopolitical security situation but has kept Israel’s credit rating itself unchanged.

title: Saturday Night Live Marks 1000th Episode Tonight
desc: The frigid grip of winter has settled across much of the United States, but for fans of live television and comedy, there’s a reason to stay in and keep warm: tonight,…

title: Meet Justice Maame Agyemang, the Ghanaian who rose to Chief Justice in two countries
desc: Justice Mabel Maame Agyemang, a Ghana-trained lawyer born and bred in Kumasi, has carved an extraordinary judicial career that has seen her rise to the highest judicial office in two different countries.

title: Be measured in your statements - Suhuyini cautions Fifi Kwetey
desc: A member of the communication team of the National Democratic Congress (NDC), Hamza Suhuyini, has expressed deep concern over recent public comments made by the party’s General Secretary, Fifi Fiavi Kwetey.

title: Mwigulu urges private sector to boost Tanzania’s global tourism

title: A Doctor Who Studies Metabolism Made 3 Changes to His Daily Routine
desc: Dr. Adam Perlman prioritizes strength training, sleep, and a low-sugar diet to boost his metabolic health.
